name: mastalgia
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
pain in the breast: Breast pain, known as mastalgia, affects two out of three women at some point in their lives. Mastalgia is generally classified as either cyclical (associated with menstrual periods) or non-cyclical.
More examplesFewer examplesSome women complain of oestrogen-induced oedema or mastalgia.Symptoms include nervous tension, irritability, mastalgia, oedema, and headache.Breast changes include mastalgia (breast pain) and breast enlargement.Gamolenic acid (GLA) has been shown to help with mastalgia and stomach cramps associated with PMS.
